name: MIPT-MIPS
tagline: Functional and performance simulators for MIPS-based microprocessor
body:
This project is a part of [Intel lab's](http://ilab.fizteh.ru) activity at [Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology](http://phystech.edu/) (MIPT). The project is being developed by a group of students under the guidance of Intel employees. The aim of the project is to teach the students the computer architecture through development of a microprocessor implementing the [MIPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MIPS32) instruction set in both functional and performance simulators. ## Lectures on Computer Architecture Here you may find lectures on the computer architecture, simulation practicums and tests of 2015/2016 year. Project participants attend these events at 18:40, room 117 of MIPT Main Building. ### Term 1: CS Basics and Components w | Date | Event | Homework :-: | :--: | ------------------------------ | -------------------------- 1 | 19 Sep | **L1: Project intro**

Lectures of previous years archive: [2014](https://github.com/MIPT-ILab/mipt-mips/wiki/Lectures on the computer architecture in 2014), [2013](https://github.com/MIPT-ILab/mipt-mips/wiki/Lectures on the computer architecture in 2013), [2012](https://github.com/MIPT-ILab/mipt-mips/wiki/Lectures on the computer architecture in 2012). ## Assignments repository In our [production repository](https://github.com/MIPT-ILab/mipt-mips) you may find C++ sources required to complete this year course assignments — step-by-step implementation of MIPS simulator. That repo has a lot of useful [Wiki manuals](https://github.com/MIPT-ILab/mipt-mips/wiki) about Git, MIPS, C++, Make utilites and so on. ## About us The project has been started in 2012 year as part of Intel lab's activity in MIPT. Since 2015, it is mentored by [Pavel Kryukov](https://github.com/pavelkryukov) and [Igor Smirnov](https://github.com/igorsmir-ilab) under [Alexander Titov's](https://github.com/alexander-titov) supervising. For more information, check [this wiki page](https://github.com/MIPT-ILab/mipt-mips/wiki/About-Us) and [Intel lab's site](http://ilab.fizteh.ru)
